content.title: Carotid Duplex Ultrasound Protocol
content.definition: A standardized ultrasound examination of the carotid arteries using B-mode imaging and Doppler spectral analysis to evaluate for atherosclerotic stenosis and plaque characteristics.

clinical_features.color: Color flow for turbulence, flow direction
clinical_features.spectral: Angle-corrected velocities at ICA, CCA, ECA

concepts.definition: Doppler criteria for grading internal carotid stenosis.

clinical_features.70_99: PSV >230 cm/s, ICA/CCA ratio >4.0, EDV >100 cm/s
clinical_features.near_occlusion: High/variable velocities, string sign on imaging

clinical_features.echogenicity: Hypo-, iso-, hyperechoic compared to sternomastoid

clinical_features.limitations: Calcified plaque may shadow, operator dependent

sources.reference: Grant EG et al. Society of Radiologists in Ultrasound Consensus Conference on Carotid Ultrasound. Radiology. 2003;229:340-346
sources.notes: Original SRU consensus establishing velocity criteria

sources.reference: AbuRahma AF et al. Society for Vascular Surgery. J Vasc Surg. 2022;75:23S-98S
sources.notes: SVS management guidelines for carotid disease
ASE/SRU guidelines for peripheral vascular ultrasound

learning_objectives: Apply velocity criteria to grade carotid stenosis
Interpret carotid duplex findings in clinical context
clinical_pearls: PSV >230 cm/s and EDV >100 cm/s indicates â‰¥70% stenosis
